result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal Lynn Smiltneek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Costs remitted.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge from up to 25% of inmate monies.

Absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, intoxicating substances or any other controlled substances.
No prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions to be verified by agent and taken only according to Dr.'s orders.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known where drugs can be obtained illegally.
No contact with J.L., G.R. or T.W.

Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
Pay court ordered financial obligations and Dept. of Corrections supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Crystal Lynn Smiltneek in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Crystal Lynn Smiltneek in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Hansen spks on sentencing
Defendant addresses Court
Court imposes:
8 years; 4 yrs inital confinement, 4 yrs extended supervision.  Credit for 160 days.  Def is eligible for CIP & SAP.
Conditions:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge, up to 25% to be deducted from inmate monies.
Costs remitted.
Pay court ordered financial obligations and Dept. of Corrections supervision fees.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.  
Absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, intoxicating substances or any other controlled substances.
No prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions to be verified by agent and taken only according to Dr.'s orders.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known whre drugs can be obtained illegally.
No contact with J.L., G.R. or T.W.
Appeal rights
Defendant remanded to custody of MSD.
